intro: Nemophila spatulata, commonly known as the spoonleaf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, sky-blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are ovate to spoon-shaped, giving it its common name. Nemophila spatulata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and meadow habitats.
